title: 104_s774
content: The Congress believes that economically targeted investments violate fiduciary loyalty to employee benefit plan participants and beneficiaries. Prohibitions are imposed on the Department of Labor regarding such investments. The Congress prohibits economically targeted investments by employee benefit plans, disregarding Interpretive Bulletin 94-1 and similar regulations. The Department of Labor is restricted from engaging in such activities. The Department of Labor is prohibited from promoting economically targeted investments through travel, lectures, or resource expenditure. Definitions for "economically targeted investment" and "employee benefit plan" are provided in the section. The Act prohibits federal agencies from establishing or maintaining any database related to economically targeted investments. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 prohibits federal agencies from establishing or maintaining any clearinghouse or database related to economically targeted investments. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 prohibits federal agencies from establishing or maintaining any clearinghouse, database, or listing for economically targeted investments. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 prohibits federal agencies from establishing or maintaining any clearinghouse, database, or listing for economically targeted investments. The term 'economically targeted investment' is defined in Interpretive Bulletin 94-1 issued by the Secretary on June 23, 1994. A clerical amendment is made to the table of contents in section 2 of the Act. SEC. 4. TERMINATION OF CONTRACTS: Federal agencies must terminate any contracts or arrangements that violate the provisions of this Act or its amendments. SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATE: The Act and its amendments will take effect upon enactment.
